title: Wales: Flood warnings ease following downpours
article: Flood warnings were put in place following heavy rain across Wales. Restrictions were also imposed on bridges due to strong winds, affecting the M48 Severn Bridge in Monmouthshire and A55 Britannia Bridge at Anglesey. Flood warnings have since been lifted in Powys, covering the River Severn at Abermule and Aberbechan and River Vyrnwy at Meifod. But flood alerts remain in place in several areas. Localised flooding has closed the A548 at Llanfair Caereinion, Powys.
